shapes

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Ellipse, Line, Text

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a shape on the canvas. It defines the basic operations and attributes of a shape. Every shape should extend this class or one of its subclasses. This class holds attributes that are available to any shape: fillColour, strokeColour, strokeWidth and opacity. Subclasses can make use of the classes Colour, RGBColour and Coordinate to describe their attributes. It implements Serializable for writing to files.
    See Also:
    Circle, Line, Polygon, Ellipse, RegularPolygon, Star, Text, Serialized Form

      • Shape

        public Shape(Colour fillColour,
             Colour strokeColour,
             double strokeWidth,
             double opacity)
        Creates a new Shape with the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        fillColour - The fill colour of the shape.
        strokeColour - The stroke colour of the shape.
        strokeWidth - The stroke width of the shape.
        opacity - The opacity of the shape. Value should be between 0 and 1.

      • getHTMLAttributes

        protected java.lang.String getHTMLAttributes()
        Returns a String representation of the Shape's attributes as chained HTML attributes. This function should ideally be extended by every subclass and integrated into getHTML(). Return example: 'fill="#FFFFFF" fill-opacity="0.2" stroke="#000000" stroke-opacity="1.0" stroke-width="1" opacity="1.0"'
        Returns:
        A String representation of the Shape's attributes as chained HTML attributes.

      • getHTML

        Returns a String representation of the Shape as an SVG object in HTML.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the Shape as an SVG object in HTML.
